patterns: What are the requirements for BA. History?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BA. History?
Requirements for BA. History programme?
What are the prerequisites for BA. History?
BA. History admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BA. History?
What are the entry requirements for BA. History?
Criteria for admission into BA. History?
BA. History programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. History
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: History or Government and any one from Economics, Geography, French, Ghanaian Language, Literature in English, Religious Studies and any other General Arts Elective and a Pass in Social Studies.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes including History and/or Government and any One (1) or Two (2) from Economics, Geography, French, Religious Studies and Ghanaian Language. Applicants must also have a pass in General Paper.


  • Mature applicants
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

patterns: What are the requirements for BA. Geography and Rural Development?

BA. Geography and Rural Development programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Geography and Rural Development
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Geography and any other TWO (2) from the following: Economics, Government, French, Literature in English, Religious Studies, History, Elective Mathematics, Akan, and any other General Arts Elective.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes including Geography and TWO (2) other Subjects from History, French, English, Akan, Religious Studies, Elective Mathematics and Economics. They must also obtain a pass in General Paper.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

Criteria for admission into BA. English?
BA. English programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. English
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) including Literature in English, and any TWO (2) from French, History, Government, Economics, Geography, Akan, Religious Studies, and any other subject in General Arts.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level: Credit passes in three subjects including Literature in English and TWO (2) other subjects from History, French, English, Akan, Religious Studies, and Economics.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

BA. French programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. French and Francophone Studies
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Good pass in French (at Grade A1-B3) and any TWO from History, Religious Studies, Economics, Geography, Government, Literature in English, Business Management, Ghanaian Language, and any other General Arts Elective.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects including French and/or Akan or any other Ghanaian Language, and any TWO (2) of the following: Literature in English, Economics, Geography, Government, History, Business Management, and Religious Studies.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects including French and/or Akan or any other Ghanaian Language, and any TWO (2) of the following: Literature in English, Economics, Geography, Government, History, Business Management, and Religious Studies.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

patterns: What are the requirements for BA. Linguistics?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BA. Linguistics?
Requirements for BA. Linguistics programme?
What are the prerequisites for BA. Linguistics?
BA. Linguistics admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BA. Linguistics?
What are the entry requirements for BA. Linguistics?
Criteria for admission into BA. Linguistics?
BA. Linguistics programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Linguistics
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) from any ONE (1) of the following options.

    • Three (3) Electives from Group A OR
    • Two (2) from Group A and One (1) from Group B OR
    • One (1) from Group A and Two (2) from Group B

      • Group A: English Literature, Ghanaian Language (e.g., Asante Twi, Akuapem Twi, and Fante, Ewe, Ga, etc.,), Foreign Language (e. g. French, Igbo, Wolof, Yoruba, etc.).

      Group B: History, Geography, Economics, Religious Studies, Government, Business Management.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects in the TWO (2) Subject Groups below:

    • Either all Subjects from Group A or
    • Two (2) subjects from Group A, and one (1) subject from Group B
    • One (1) subject from Group A, and Two (2) subjects from Group B

      • GROUP A: English Literature, Ghanaian Language (e.g., Asante Twi, Akuapem Twi, Fante, Ewe, Ga, etc.), Foreign Language (e. g. French, Igbo, Wolof, Yoruba, etc.).

      GROUP B: History, Geography, Economics, Religious Studies, Government, Business Management. They must also have a pass in General Paper.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

  • DIPLOMA APPLICANTS

    • Diploma (Second Class Lower or better) in Communication Studies or a related programme; e.g. Archival Studies, Journalism and International Relations.

responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Media and Communication Studies
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in any THREE (3) Elective subjects


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects in the TWO (2) Subject Groups below:

    • Either all Subjects from Group A or
    • Two (2) subjects from Group A, and one (1) subject from Group B
    • One (1) subject from Group A, and Two (2) subjects from Group B

      • GROUP A: English Literature, Ghanaian Language (e.g., Asante Twi, Akuapem Twi, Fante, Ewe, Ga, etc.), Foreign Language (e. g. French, Igbo, Wolof, Yoruba, etc.).

      GROUP B: History, Geography, Economics, Religious Studies, Government, Business Management. They must also have a pass in General Paper.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

  • DIPLOMA APPLICANTS

    • Diploma (Second Class Lower or better) in Communication Studies or a related programme; e.g. Archival Studies, Journalism and International Relations.

BA. Sociology programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Sociology
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) from History, Geography, Literature in English, French, Ghanaian Language, Government, Business Management, Elective Mathematics, Economics and other General Arts Elective and Science Electives.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from Government, Religious Studies, History, Economics, and Literature in English, French, Ghanaian Language and Elective Mathematics. They must also have a pass in General Paper.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

  • DIPLOMA APPLICANTS
    • Diploma in Social Work/Social Administration and any other relevant Diploma from an accredited university or Institution.
    • An applicant must pass a written examination and interview. Such candidates would be admitted into the second year of the Programme.

patterns: What are the requirements for BA. Religious Studies?

BA. Religious Studies admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BA. Religious Studies?

Criteria for admission into BA. Religious Studies?
BA. Religious Studies programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Religious Studies
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) General Arts subjects, including Christian Religious Studies (CRS) or Islamic Religious Studies (IRS).


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from Christian Religious Studies, History, Literature in English, French, Economics, Government, and Geography.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

  • DIPLOMA APPLICANTS

    • Diploma or Higher National Diploma in Religious Studies or Theology with a Minimum Grade “B+” from an Accredited University or Theological Seminary will be admitted into the SECOND YEAR of the programme, subject to passing an entrance examination and interview.

patterns: What are the requirements for BA. Economics?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BA. Economics?
Requirements for BA. Economics programme?
What are the prerequisites for BA. Economics?
BA. Economics admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BA. Economics?
What are the entry requirements for BA. Economics?
Criteria for admission into BA. Economics?
BA. Economics programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Economics
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Mathematics, and any TWO (2) of the following:

    • General Arts: Economics, Geography, Government, History, Literature in English, French, Christian Religious Studies, Ghanaian Language, Information and Communication Technology (ICT)
    • Business: Economics, Principles of Cost Accounting, Business Management, Costing, and ICT
    • General Science: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Geography, and ICT
    • Technical: Technical Drawing, Engineering Science, Applied Electricity, Auto mechanics, Woodwork, Metalwork, and ICT
    • Home Economics: Management in Living, Clothing and Textiles, Food and Nutrition, Textiles, General Knowledge in Arts, French, Biology, Chemistry
    • Visual Arts: General Knowledge in Art, Literature in English, Graphic Design, Picture Making, Sculpture, Ceramics, Batik, Tie and Dye

  • A LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects including Economics, Mathematics and any ONE from Geography, French, Literature in English, Business Management, History, Government etc. Applicants must also have a pass in General Paper.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant must be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must also satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE OR 'A' Level.

patterns: What are the requirements for Bachelor of Law (LLB)?
What are the requirements for Law?
Can you provide the admission criteria for LLB programme?
Requirements for LLB programme?
What are the prerequisites for LLB?
What are the prerequisites for law?
law admission requirements?
LLB admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for LLB?
Information on eligibility for Law?
What are the entry requirements for LLB programme?
What are the entry requirements for Law programme?
Criteria for admission into LLB?
LLB programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for Bachelor of Law (LLB)
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS (Category I)

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) from the following programmes: General Arts; Business; Visual Art or General Science.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS (Category I)

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in relevant subjects in General Science, Business, Visual Art or General Arts.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS (Category I)
    • An applicant should be at least 25 years at the time of the application.
    • An applicant must satisfy the requirements for either WASSCE/SSSCE or 'A' Level
    • Short-listed Applicants shall take an entrance examination and pass an interview. Applicants in this category will be required to pursue the Programme for Four (4) Years.

      • Mature applicants must be non-degree holders.

  • OTHER APPLICANTS (Category II)

    • Degree and/or Higher Degree Holders in Any Discipline

    Applicants must satisfy the University's General Requirements for Admission into Degree Programmes.

    Applicants with the above qualification in any discipline may apply. Short-listed applicants shall take an entrance examination and pass an interview.

    Applicants in category II

    • Will be required to pursue the Programme, in Parallel mode, for Three (3) years
    • Mature applicants with a Diploma with more than Ten (10) years working experience may apply under this category.

Here are the requirements for BSc. Business Administration (Human Resource Management/Management)
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from any of the following groups: Business, General Arts, General Science, and Vocational/Home Economics.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects in General Arts, Business, and General Science.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant should be at least 25 years at the time of submitting the application.
    • An applicant must satisfy the requirement for either 'A' Level or WASSCE/SSSCE with credit passes in THREE (3) Elective Subjects in Business, General Arts, General Science, and Vocational/Home Economics.
    • Short-listed Applicants shall take an entrance examination and pass an interview.

  • OTHER APPLICANTS
    • General Business Certificate (GBCE) and/or Advanced Business Certificate (ABCE):
      • Credit passes in at least SIX (6) subjects including English Language and Business Mathematics at the GBCE, or
      • Credit passes in the THREE (3) relevant Compulsory Subjects and THREE (3) Optional Subjects at the ABCE.
      • Applicants need both GBCE and ABCE to qualify.

    • ACCA, ICA, ACIB or CIM:
      • Credit passes at WASSCE/SSSCE in THREE (3) Core Subjects and THREE Electives OR,
      • FIVE (5) credit passes at the 'O' Level including English Language and Mathematics. Applicants in this category are admitted into year one.

    • HND with Second Class (Lower Division) and above:
      • Credit passes at WASSCE/SSSCE in THREE (3) Core subjects and THREE (3) Electives OR,
      • FIVE (5) credit passes at 'O' level including English language and mathematics. These applicants would be placed in either Year Two (2) or Year Three (3) after passing an entrance examination/interview.
